subject: Career
title: Remote Conflict Resolution
description: A tiny lesson with a big payoff: Remote Conflict Resolution.

hook.text: The Slack message read: 'Fine.' Was she angry? Agreeing? Being passive-aggressive? Text strips all tone.

buildup.text: Remote conflicts escalate faster because text communication strips emotional cues that prevent misunderstandings.

discovery.text: Research shows people interpret ambiguous messages negatively 60% of the time. We assume the worst.

twist.text: The fix isn't more emojis. It's switching to video when tension appears. Faces rebuild empathy instantly.

climax.text: Rule of thumb: if a text exchange exceeds three back-and-forths with tension, switch to a video call.

punchline.text: Don't resolve conflict in text. Pixels don't carry empathy. Faces do.

quiz.question: How often do people interpret ambiguous messages negatively?
